duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead, manage, and develop three sections of the nursery’s seed program: wild seed collection, seed increase, and the seed bank.
Supervise and manage staff and workload of the wild seed collection team, seed increase program, and seed bank.
Promote a strong sense of purpose and shared vision, foster a collaborative and innovative work environment, and communicate with other managers to ensure smooth production flow.
Lead the strategic development of the seed program and seed products at the nursery through market research, analysis, and development of best practices.
Oversee all aspects of seed storage, including inventory management, logistics of distribution, seed bank maintenance, quality control, seed testing, and client relationships.
Ensure the proper functioning and maintenance of seed bank, seed lab, and seed cleaning equipment.
Participate in the annual purchasing process for nursery supplies and equipment relating to the seed team.
Supervise, train, instruct, and motivate full-time and seasonal staff, as well as volunteers, interns and alternative workforce employees assigned to the nursery.
Maintain accurate inventory of supplies relating to the seed team.

education_certification.credential: Baccalaureate degree in horticulture, arboriculture or landscape architecture with four years of horticultural work experience, two of which must have been in a supervisory, administrative, consultative, managerial, or executive capacity.
High school diploma or equivalent and one year of supervisory, administrative, consultative, managerial, or executive experience
